description: From Old French certefier (“confirm, assure, make certain”). Compare French certifier.

verbs.description: certify (third-person singular simple present certifies, present participle certifying, simple past and past participle certified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To attest to (a fact) as the truth.
(transitive, law) To authenticate or verify in writing.
(transitive) To attest that a product, service, organization, or person has met an official standard.
examples: These blankets have been certified as fireproof.

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To inform; to tell (a person) that something is true.
examples: Our deeds do us three manners of service. First, they certify us that we are heirs of everlasting life, and that the Spirit of God, which is the earnest thereof, is in us.

entries.meaning: (archaic, reflexive) To assure (oneself) of something; to ascertain.
